page.title: 11LEE MOOR AREA-WILDLIFE.
page.content: Being on the edge of Dartmoor all kinds of wildlife can be seen,such as rabbits,foxes,badgers and small rodents.Interestingly,the area where china clay has been extracted around Lee Moor also provides habitats for animals.It is said that foxes which are being chased in foxhunts head for the china clay workings because the dogs and horses are unable to follow them.Eventually,when the extraction of china clay has finished(which could take over one hundred years) it is hoped to turn the area into a country park.Also,Canada geese are nesting on the mica dams.One good thing about the waste tips of sand is that they are not toxic and vegetation is being encouraged to grow on the tip.The wooded areas in the grid provide a habitat for many kinds of woodland birds.
